big.process1D.filter
Class EvenSymmetricFIRFilter

java.lang.Object
  big.process1D.filter.EvenSymmetricFIRFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
FIRConvolver
Direct Known Subclasses:
EvenSymmetricFiniteDifferences
public class EvenSymmetricFIRFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements FIRConvolver

This class encapsulates discrete-convolution operations on one-dimensional data with a filter that has an even-symmetric impulse response.

Constructor Summary
EvenSymmetricFIRFilter(double[] halfImpulseResponse)
          This constructor builds a convolver with the provided causal part of the impulse response of the filter.
 
Method Summary
 Data1D getConvolution(Data1D data)
          Returns the result of the convolution between this filter and the argument data.
 Filter1D getImpulseResponse()
          Returns the impulse response of this filter.
 void inPlaceConvolve(Data1D data)
          Performs the convolution between this filter and the argument data.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

EvenSymmetricFIRFilter

public EvenSymmetricFIRFilter(double[] halfImpulseResponse)
This constructor builds a convolver with the provided causal part of the impulse response of the filter. For example, if the impulse response of a filter with even symmetry is {0.05, 0.15, 0.6, 0.15, 0.05}, then its causal part is {0.6, 0.15, 0.05}.

Parameters:
halfImpulseResponse - the provided causal part of the impulse response of the filter.
Method Detail

getConvolution

public Data1D getConvolution(Data1D data)
Returns the result of the convolution between this filter and the argument data. The following combinations of size and boundary extensions are considered, with N = data.size() and K = halfImpulseResponse.length:
Extension (in)Size (in)Size (Filter)Size (out)Extension (out)
ANTIMIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLESN2 K - 1NANTIMIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLES
ANTIMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLESN2 K - 1NANTIMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
ANTISYMMETRICN2 K - 1NANTISYMMETRIC
FINITE_SUPPORTN1 (K = 1)NFINITE_SUPPORT
INVALIDN1 (K = 1)NINVALID
MIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLESN2 K - 1NMIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLES
MIRRORS_ON_SAMPLESN2 K - 1NMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
PERIODICN2 K - 1NPERIODIC
SPREAD_EXTREMAL_VALUES12 K - 11SPREAD_EXTREMAL_VALUES
SPREAD_EXTREMAL_VALUESN1 (K = 1)NSPREAD_EXTREMAL_VALUES
All other combinations result in an exception of type IllegalArgumentException.

Specified by:
getConvolution in interface FIRConvolver
Parameters:
data - the data to convolve.

the result of the convolution.

inPlaceConvolve

public void inPlaceConvolve(Data1D data)
Performs the convolution between this filter and the argument data. The following combinations of size and boundary extensions are considered, with N = data.size() and K = halfImpulseResponse.length:
Extension (in)Size (in)Size (Filter)Extension (out)
ANTIMIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLESN2 K - 1ANTIMIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLES
ANTIMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLESN2 K - 1ANTIMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
ANTISYMMETRICN2 K - 1ANTISYMMETRIC
FINITE_SUPPORTN1 (K = 1)FINITE_SUPPORT
INVALIDN1 (K = 1)INVALID

MIRRORS_ON_SAMPLESN2 K - 1MIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
